newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Colombo market regulator urges investor promotion.
newsitem.headline: Colombo market regulator urges investor promotion.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is seeking investment promotion plans from the Colombo Stock Exchange and the Unit Trusts Association following a market upturn, an SEC official said on Thursday.
"We believe the recent turnaround should be used to attract investment into the stocks market and unit trusts," said Kumar Paul, director-general of the SEC.
Colombo's all share index has gained 4.2 percent or 25.95 points so far this year on the back of good corporate profits in the last quarter of 1996.
The stock market declined last year after corporate profits by hurt by power cuts due to a drought.
"It is a good time to carry out a well thought out plan to encourage investors to return to stocks and units, after many got burnt in last year's decline," Paul said.
